clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Altered Glycometabolic Status and Joint Inflammation in Diabetic Patients With Osteoarthritis Undergoing Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Altered Glycometabolic Status and Joint Inflammation in Diabetic Patients With Osteoarthritis Undergoing Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the correlation between altered glycometabolic status and joint inflammation in diabetic patients with osteoarthritis undergoing knee replacement surgery

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate if there is a linear positive correlation between plasma glycated hemoglobin concentration HbA1c and synovial IL-6 in diabetic patient
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate if there is a linear positive correlation between plasma glycated hemoglobin concentration HbA1c and synovial IL-6 in diabetic patient

intervention.intervention_name: Evaluation of Synovial IL-6 in diabetic patients with gonarthrosis
intervention.description: To evaluate if there is a linear positive correlation between plasma glycated hemoglobin concentration HbA1c and synovial IL-6 in diabetic patients
intervention.other_name: Evaluation of plasmatic HbA1c in diabetic patients with gonarthrosis

study_pop.textblock: The population is made up of diabetic patients, of age, undergoing knee replacement surgery for osteoarthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic patients
- Patients with osteoarthritis awaiting knee replacement surgery
- Patients awaiting knee replacement surgery
- Patients who agree to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients less than 55 years of age.
- Patients over 85 years of age.
- Patients who are unable to understand and want.
- Patients with severe neurological disorders or with severe disabilities.
- Rheumatoid arthritis patients
- Cancer patients
- Patients suffering from chronic inflammatory bowel syndromes (RCU and Crohn's disease)
- Patients on immunosuppressive therapy
